review_text: This Beach is perfect. Very isolated and not as populated as the other nearby beaches. Perfect for sunrise and sunset to walk with your partner. Waves are not that aggressive and not too many people. I would come again
Our daughter has a condo on the beach here.  She also took a surfing lesson here.  There is a shelf of rocks along the beach in some places, but there are sandy places.
Perfect beach for enjoying warm weather and friends. We packed some drinks and ate at a local restaurant for a simple day at the beach.

We enjoyed this beach very much. The waves were great and not too strong. My husband and 11 year old son body surfed most of the day. The beach sand was nice and no rocks. Our belongings felt safe on the beach when we were swimming. After swimming we walked to Tamboo and had drinks and a nice meal.
Beautiful Beach!  Great for surfers and those who love lots of waves.  Nice place to relax on the beach!

This is a perfect place to have a chill afternoon on the beach in Rincon. Tamboo Tavern is right on the beach, serving up delicious food and drinks. The beach is even without a big drop off. My husband has traditionally come here every visit for bodysurfing with my father in law. It is a bit more crowded than other beaches in Rincon but not overwhelmingly so. There's also a trailer in the parking lot on the right side of the beach that rents surfboards, chairs, umbrellas, and other equipment.

review_title: A quiet little piece of Paradise
review_text: Spent a week in Rincon and went to this beach daily. It was never crowded and the surf was great! Everyone had fun playing in the waves.

This eco tour was amazing! Beautiful sights all the way through. The tour guides Jose & Omar were very friendly and helpful and very well educated about the waters and caves. I 100% recommend this tour for anyone who is wanting to try it.

Visited this beach twice during our visit to Rincon. Beautiful setting, supposed to be good for sea glass hunting. The waves were too large for this, but was still a beautiful beach which I plan to visit again. Homes/condos on this beach are beautiful.

Another beautiful beach in Rincon.  No resorts or manicured beach here.  No entrance fee & not a crowded beach.  Good for swimming on shallow end, surfing, boogie boarding, beach walking, picnics and more.  If you like sea glass, you can find it on Sandy Beach.  No bathrooms and shower areas.  Although there’s no restaurants on the beach, we had seen coffee shops, gift shops and restaurants along the road.  There’s a store to rent non-motorized water equipment like boogie boards by the entrance in the parking lot.

Absolutely one of our favorite beaches in Rincon! Some days see amazing surf, some days see calm conditions perfect for bathing. If you don’t like the conditions one day, wait a day and they will change. Great beach for laying out. Hopping bars and restaurants line the charming little neighborhood that surround the beach. As long as high N/NE winds aren’t in the forecast, this is the beach to go to!

Beautiful beach. Beware the surf can be rough for swimmers and this beach is notorious for rip currents. My friends was pulled out several indeed feet within seconds and had a hard time swimming back to shore. Apparently there are several drownings per year at Sandy Beach.
Love Sandy Beach. Does get a little crowded on the weekend so get there early.  Great beach for families

Hard to go wrong on any beach in Rincon.. surf capital of Puerto Rico.. this beach has the surf and sand and also the jungle at its  edges ... great for shade and also checking out iguanas when you’re not checking out the surf ...also has very cool surfing community all around it
Beautiful beach always a nice breeze and you have a bar you can walk to and grab drinks. Use the restroom etc...

I love the beach and sandy beach made my stay in Rincon. It’s called sandy beach for a reason...the sand is so beautiful and the water is very clear  blue. This is paradise!!! It’s not crowded, just a few people here and there...plenty of space and you can nap without being disturbed. This was like a private beach for us. It was so tranquil. Check it out please!!!
nice and quiet, not too many people.  Almost feels like a private beach.  Take your own chairs and umbrellas.

While staying in Isla Verde my husband and I decided to spend the day checking out Rincon. It was about a two hour drive on a Friday. I had researched a few Rincon beaches to check out and Sandy Beach was one of them.  It's not advertised with signage on the road so it was hard to find.  Small parking lot, no one around.  There are houses on the beach so those occupants were around, but that's it. We were approached by a couple guys selling homemade lava cakes, which we bought for $5 each and then were stopped by a guy who ran out of gas and needed money, so we gave him some.  At this point, we took some pics on the beach, drank a few beers then moved on.  I wouldn't waste my time stopping.  We found the downtown public beach had more facilities, a restaurant and not do desolate. Don't get me wrong, we do like quiet beaches with few people like on Vieques, but this one wasn't very appealing.

It was a very nice beach with calm waves, when we went in the early morning on Wednesday we were the only people out there for a while. However in the shallow waters the bottom appears to be a flat rock surface which was not my favorite.
Perhaps not the most beautiful nor picturesque beach, but a nice place to spend a lazy, relaxing afternoon with friends.
Quiet and nice place to love nature. Locals are really friendly and there are a few places walking distance to eat.

Met friends for picnic at the beach . There’s plenty of Americans here to exchange adventures with and get new ideas. But this beach never disappoints and if you get lucky you can find some nice sea glass here as well...
Beautiful beach, gorgeous water, rolling waves.  Make sure you go.  Several entry points along the road.

Loved being right on the beach.  Listened to the waves day and night.  Not too crowded, and most days were able to watch surfers.  Saw whales off the shore the first day (3 of them) and none the rest of the week.  Sand near the shore is pretty gravely.  Surf can be rough, but water is nice.  A little drop off when entering the water and waves can make it a challenge to get out

When conditions are right, great beach to hang out on and watch surfers “catch a wave”! Tamboo restaurant has a covered deck and a delicious whole Fried Snapper on yummy sauce when available. People watching is also fun on Sandy Beach!

One of my favorites beaches in Rincon. My boyfriend was looking for good waves so we stopped here. Its a surfer ‘s beach and you can also enjoy a nice walk through the beach and chill. lots of restaurants around the area, many options of food and drinks. Highly recommended.
The beach is very sandy with beautiful views.  Nice stretch to walk along as well.  This area is good for surfing.  Not a calm beach if that is what you are looking for.
No rocks on the shore and boards are available for rent right on the beach! $25 for 4 hours with is a half day.  Ge there early to rent the best boards.
This was our favorite beach!!  It was sparsely populated and had nice shade trees, a lovely place to spend the day

Great spot for surfers and awesome beach to view a great sunset, walks on the beach and if your a strong swimmer that could work but lots of surfers. Also there’s some good shipping and raw oyster bar plenty to do.

Absolutely one of our favorite beaches in Rincon! Some days see amazing surf, some days see calm conditions perfect for bathing. If you don’t like the conditions one day, wait a day and they will change. Great beach for laying out. Hopping bars and restaurants line the charming little neighborhood that surround the beach. As long as high N/NE winds aren’t in the forecast, this is the beach to go to!

Beautiful beach. Beware the surf can be rough for swimmers and this beach is notorious for rip currents. My friends was pulled out several indeed feet within seconds and had a hard time swimming back to shore. Apparently there are several drownings per year at Sandy Beach.
Love Sandy Beach. Does get a little crowded on the weekend so get there early.  Great beach for families
